instructions:
1. Add the whiskey and simple syrup into a mixing tin.
2. Add a small amount of boiling water to an 11-ounce mug to heat it, and nestle the tin in the mug so that the tin heats as well.
3. Dump the water out of the mug, add the whiskey-sugar mixture and top with boiling water to about 1 inch below the rim of the glass.
4. Pour the espresso shot directly into the mug.
5. Float the cream on top and garnish with freshly grated cinnamon.


 ## Editors note:

### Whipped Heavy Cream:

Pour several ounces of heavy cream into a mixing tin. Dry shake without ice until the cream begins to thicken, but is still pourable.
description: The best Irish Coffee cocktail recipe, which won our tasting of variations on the drink, combines Irish whiskey, espresso and whipped cream.

ingredients.name: Irish whiskey
ingredients.description: Produced in Ireland, often made from a mix of malted and unmalted barley and aged for a minimum period in wooden casks. Styles include single malt, single pot still, blended Irish whiskey, and others.
ingredients.note: preferably Powers Gold Label Irish Whiskey

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made with sugar and water. Usually in 1:1 or 2:1 ratio.

ingredients.name: Espresso
ingredients.description: Espresso is generally thicker than coffee brewed by other methods, with a viscosity similar to that of warm honey.

ingredients.name: Cream
ingredients.description: Cream is a dairy product composed of the higher-fat layer skimmed from the top of milk before homogenization.
